sense.name: mend or provide with a patch
sense.examples: They patched up the cracks in the sinking ship. So they patched the leak and spray painted the ceiling back to a nice white. One site commented they were patching workstations and Citrix servers on an expedited basis. She patched her clothes as best she could. A Microsoft update will patch a critical flaw in Windows. They patched up his leg following the accident.

sense.name: connect (to a communications network)
sense.examples: In the one phone call we listened to, she patched in two different gang members. He patched me through to the collections department.

sense.name: reconcile (emotionally)
sense.examples: She returned home and patched things up with her mother.

sense.name: Incorporate an element into a larger entity.
sense.examples: I think we can patch in that commercial later in the hour. They patched in an additional paragraph describing the project.

sense.name: Bring elements together, perhaps in a hurried fashion.
sense.examples: They finally patched the deal together this afternoon. He patched together an offer letter fifteen minutes before the meeting.
